discussion.p: <array> must be added to this list. In particular it doesn't satisfy: - no swap() function invalidates any references, pointers, or iterators referring to the elements of the containers being swapped. and probably doesn't satisfy: - no swap() function throws an exception.
If <array> remains a container, this will have to also reference array, which will then have to say which of these points it satisfies.
discussion.blockquote: Agree. The proposed resolution is incomplete. Further work required.
Issue also suggests adding move constructor to this.
Howard is to draft a note that explains what happens to references.
Mark as NAD. No consensus for change.

blockquote.pre: template <Swappable T, size_t N> void swap(array<T,N>& x, array<T,N>& y);

p.ins: [Note: Outstanding iterators, references and pointers may be invalidated. — end note]
